pullRequest.body:
Greetings! In this PR I attempt to generalize `IsSeparable.of_equiv_equiv` and some related codes to noncommutative cases. This could be useful in #16525 

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [5fdb8f7936](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17147/commits/5fdb8f79365ced5a2a83c38929eb657fa8fa6cee)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

~~Some major problems unsolved:~~

~~1. I want `algebraComp` in Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Defs.lean (line 366) to be an instance instead of definition, so that I can get rid of all `haveI` in the statement of newly added lemmas. But directly change it into instance will yield error `cannot find synthesization order`.~~
~~2. Regarding the two `sorry` in Mathlib/FieldTheory/Separable.lean (line 732), the annotated `exact` gives exactly the same things but they don't seem to work.~~
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/1d225343-bb6e-4b61-abbb-1895f31d1ea8) for commit cd595413a0dd27aae31944a8e348bef252e08478.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/50341b2c-7082-4a7f-993b-957ca465e9fa/to/1d225343-bb6e-4b61-abbb-1895f31d1ea8) against commit a95aae112143332f4f21618ff217e17b50be5dc7:
```diff
  Benchmark      Metric                 Change
  =====================================================
- build          .olean serialization    10.6%
- build          import                  12.2%
- build          initialization          10.6%
- open Mathlib   task-clock              15.7% (43.1 œÉ)
- open Mathlib   wall-clock              13.3% (24.7 œÉ)
```

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-2.299‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.0%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Separable`|-1.765‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-4.24%)|
These bench results are a bit weird. I am merging master and benching again.

These bench results are reminiscent of @Kha's observation that the times kept on changing by +- several percents due to two OS versions being used simultaneously on the benchmark machines. It will indeed probably disappear after merging master.
!bench

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/beff5a45-a50f-4673-838a-2d6944fbbf8a) for commit 5fdb8f79365ced5a2a83c38929eb657fa8fa6cee.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/5f90ee5c-39e2-43e7-ade2-2669c6094044/to/beff5a45-a50f-4673-838a-2d6944fbbf8a) against commit 250bf30b823d812379be4b3b5fe134edbc6ea8cc.

|File|Instructions|%|
|-|-:|:-:|
|`build`|-3.38‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(+0.0%)|
|`Mathlib.FieldTheory.Separable`|-1.817‚¨ù10‚Åπ|(-3.77%)|

Thanks!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11593394483/job/32277341575)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11593394483/job/32277341901)
Thanks! Except for a minor suggestion, all changes seem good to me!

Hey! Sorry for the huge delay. This PR looks good, thank you for submitting üòÑ 

maintainer merge
Thanks! Except for a minor suggestion, all changes seem good to me!

Hey! Sorry for the huge delay. This PR looks good, thank you for submitting üòÑ 

maintainer merge

```suggestion
        commutes' := fun r x ‚Ü¶ (Algebra.commutes) (e‚ÇÅ.symm.toRingHom r) x
```
Thanks! Implemented.
I think it is possible to omit the instance name `alg1` here.
Indeed, that certainly makes things neater, thanks!

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(FieldTheory.Separable) : generalize `IsSeparable.of_equiv_equiv` to noncommutative cases

source.title: feat(FieldTheory.JacobsonNoether) : add proof of the Jacobson-Noether theorem
